summary: Email chain between Assistant U.S. Attorney Maurene Comey and defense attorney Glen McGorty scheduling a second proffer interview via WebEx for an unnamed client (Mr. [REDACTED]). The interview aims to discuss the client's interactions with an employee in Saint Thomas who had Epstein listed as a contact, and the client's own interactions with Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Maurene Comey
persons.context: Prosecutor from the Southern District of New York corresponding with defense counsel to schedule a proffer interview regarding a client's connections to Jeffrey Epstein and an employee in Saint Thomas.

persons.name: Glen McGorty
persons.context: Attorney at Crowell & Moring LLP representing an unnamed client (Mr. [REDACTED]) in discussions with the U.S. Attorney's Office regarding a proffer interview about connections to Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Daniel Zelenko
persons.context: Copied on the email correspondence regarding the scheduling of the proffer interview, likely part of the legal team.

persons.name: Danielle Giffuni
persons.context: Copied on the email correspondence regarding the scheduling of the proffer interview, likely part of the legal team.

persons.name: Josh Morrissey
persons.context: IT group member at Crowell & Moring LLP added to ensure technical readiness for the WebEx meeting.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Central figure in the investigation; the proffer interview aims to ask about the client's interactions with him.

connections.description: McGorty is the defense attorney representing the unnamed client in proffer discussions with the U.S. Attorney's Office.
Prosecutor and defense attorney corresponding to schedule a proffer interview for McGorty's client.
The U.S. Attorney's Office intends to ask the client about any interactions he had with Jeffrey Epstein.
The interview will focus on the client's interactions with an employee who worked in Saint Thomas and who had Epstein listed as a contact.

events.title: Scheduled Proffer Interview
events.description: Second proffer interview scheduled via WebEx between the U.S. Attorney's Office and an unnamed client (Mr. [REDACTED]) represented by Glen McGorty.

events.title: Execution of Proffer Agreement
events.description: Glen McGorty sends the signed proffer agreement to the U.S. Attorney's Office, referencing a meeting that occurred the previous day.

keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office is investigating an unnamed individual's (Mr. [REDACTED]) interactions with an employee in Saint Thomas who had Jeffrey Epstein listed as a contact in their phone.
A second proffer interview was scheduled for November 12, 2020, to ask about the timeline and nature of those interactions, as well as any direct interactions with Epstein.
The correspondence involves a signed proffer agreement, indicating a formal cooperation arrangement between the client and prosecutors.
The email chain highlights the ongoing investigative efforts by the Southern District of New York into Epstein's network in late 2020.
